subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to automatically run two complete sets of tests?

Pat:
	We have an equivalent issue, which we solved by specifying the data 
source in a config file. We have two test sets, one running the tests 
against the test SQL Server DB, another running against a different data 
source. By having the test cases load the correct config file, we have 
them both run automatically.

Jim
Pat Farrell wrote:
 > Hi,
 > I've got about 250 JUnit tests so far for my little system, and
 > it is working great. But....
 >
> I've got two flavors to test. one with a real JDCB database
> connection, and a fake-connection one for when there
> is no SQL database to connect to.
